title: General
stimulusHtml:
4 points maximum

Explanation of relationship (1 point)

  • As metabolism increases, oxygen consumption increases.
    OR,

  • As metabolism decreases, oxygen consumption decreases.

Discussion (1 point per bullet; 3 points maximum)

Interpretation of graph

  • General statement that increasing temperature increases metabolic rate/oxygen consumption (no specific mention of variety A or B).

OR,

  • Variety A: rate of metabolism/oxygen consumption increases with an increase in temperature.

  • Variety B: rate of metabolism/oxygen consumption increases with an increase in temperature.

Comparison of varieties

  • Variety B has a higher metabolism/ oxygen consumption than variety A at either temperature.

  • Variety B has better metabolism/ oxygen consumption at lower temperatures than variety A.

Elaboration of temperature

  • Kinetic energy increases with temperature.

  • Enzyme reaction rates increase with temperature.

  • Effects on electron transport chain (ETC)/system.
